channel.title: Comments on: How to Expose User Information

item.title: By: mahemoff
item.dc:creator: mahemoff
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/04/11/how-to-expose-user-information/#comment-62">Bruno Pedro</a>.
Agree, it's a nice pattern and makes sense to use it most of the time. Not always though, e.g. you might have a client library that does something with $.get("#{user.name}").
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Bruno Pedro.

Agree, it’s a nice pattern and makes sense to use it most of the time. Not always though, e.g. you might have a client library that does something with $.get(“#{user.name}”).

item.title: By: Bruno Pedro
item.dc:creator: Bruno Pedro
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/04/11/how-to-expose-user-information/#comment-60">Michael Mahemoff</a>.
I agree when you're reading/writing information about a specific user other than the one authorized. When you're trying to figure out the username of the authorized user I believe /users/me makes more sense.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Michael Mahemoff.

I agree when you’re reading/writing information about a specific user other than the one authorized. When you’re trying to figure out the username of the authorized user I believe /users/me makes more sense.
